paper_abstract: In this paper we study planar first-passage percolation (FPP) models on random Delaunay triangulations. In [14], Vahidi-Asl and Wierman showed, using sub-additivity theory, that the rescaled first-passage time converges to a finite and non-negative constant mu. We show a sufficient condition to ensure that mu > 0 and derive some upper bounds for fluctuations. Our proofs are based on percolation ideas and on the method of martingales with bounded increments.
paper_title: Asymptotics for First-Passage Times on Delaunay Triangulations
